summary: The Stop Comstock Act (H.R. 2029) aims to revise aspects of U.S. law related to obscenity and the Comstock Act. It proposes amendments to sections of Title 18 (Criminal Code) and the Tariff Act of 1930. The bill seeks to remove language related to "indecent" materials, as well as provisions concerning materials and articles related to abortion. It aims to narrow the scope of prohibited materials to focus on "obscene materials."
